programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang visits Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky at his San Francisco home to discuss the highs and lows of Airbnb's success and his hopes for a more connected future; Chang and Chesky also swap perspectives on AI during a cookie bake-off.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang meets with Hailey Bieber and talks about founding her skincare company, Rhode, the bubble of celebrity beauty brands, online backlash, and gossip.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Barbie has finally stepped out of the toy aisle and onto the big screen in her Hollywood debut; Mattel hopes to use that to its advantage by transforming iconic IP into blockbuster hits; Barbie, with all her controversial history, is at the center.

programme.title: Bloomberg Primer
programme.desc: Scientists are developing more powerful magnets to enable clean energy sources like fusion; China's dominance of the supply chain for rare earth magnets threatens their global availability.

programme.title: Bloomberg Primer
programme.desc: Exploring the world of biocomputing; scientists are laying the foundation for a field that may blur the lines between the biological and synthetic.

programme.title: Bloomberg Primer
programme.desc: Scientists and entrepreneurs are testing radical ideas like solar radiation management and ocean fertilization; they are finding funding for them.

programme.title: Bloomberg Primer
programme.desc: The idea of flying cars has largely remained science fiction, until now; a new generation of electrified aircraft is attracting the attention of investors and venture capitalists around the world.

programme.title: Bloomberg Primer
programme.desc: Governments and entrepreneurs are racing to commercialize the moon; these efforts could unlock a new, deep-space economy; but to return and stay will require the highest levels of innovation.

programme.title: An Optimist's Guide to the Planet
programme.desc: Nikolaj begins his global journey to find out how to tell dusk from dawn in the age of climate change; from the scientists behind carbon neutral jet fuel to the oceanographer creating cloud cover for the Great Barrier Reef, the answer becomes clear.

programme.title: An Optimist's Guide to the Planet
programme.desc: Shelter is one of humanity's most basic needs; but as the global population grows, so does the construction industry's environmental footprint.

programme.title: Bloomberg Investigates
programme.desc: Brazil's largest bank robbery; at the heart of the brazen heist is South America's most dangerous gang and its raid on what's is known as the Night of Terror.

programme.title: Bloomberg Investigates
programme.desc: The demand for human eggs is booming, giving rise to a largely unregulated and dangerous marketplace; in India, meeting a teenage girl caught up in this fertility underworld.

programme.title: Bloomberg Investigates: How a Ugandan Clinic Exposed a Private Healthcare Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Bloomberg Investigates: How a Ugandan Clinic Exposed a Private Healthcare Tragedy
programme.desc: In a Kampala slum, a group of midwives help vulnerable mothers give birth for free. Under a mile away, a private hospital is out of reach for most of the community, with devastating consequences.

programme.title: Bloomberg Investigates
programme.desc: Fake permits, undercover informants and millions of dollars are involved; a US government agency works to prove suppliers to research labs import wild monkeys from Cambodia with false paperwork.

programme.title: Bloomberg Investigates
programme.desc: An estimated $1 trillion lost globally to fraud; with law enforcement struggling to cope, scambaiter vigilantes are filling the gaps.

programme.title: Sex-for-Work Claims in West Africa's Rubber Industry
programme.sub-title: Sex-for-Work Claims in West Africa's Rubber Industry
programme.desc: A company majority-owned by billionaire Vincent Bolloré's Bolloré Group and Hubert Fabri is the subject of allegations of labor abuses at some of its African rubber plantations, including by female workers who say they were forced to engage in sex.

programme.title: Roblox's Predator Problem
programme.desc: Tens of millions of kids play Roblox daily, but is the internet's playground safe? Bloomberg investigates cases of predators who have used the platform to groom and sometimes meet kids in real life.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance Radio
programme.desc: The economy and the markets are under surveillance as the latest developments in finance, economics and investment is covered; Tom Keene, Paul Sweeney, Lisa Mateo, Michael Barr and other guests create some intriguing conversation.

programme.title: Bloomberg Intelligence
programme.desc: Bloomberg's Alix Steel and Paul Sweeney harness the power of Bloomberg Intelligence to provide in-depth research and data on more than 2,000 companies and 130 industries.

programme.title: Balance of Power
programme.desc: Focusing on politics and policies on Capitol Hill, in President Trump's administration, the federal agencies and the courts.

programme.title: Bloomberg Businessweek
programme.desc: Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec bring together the latest news from the worlds of business and finance and the interesting stories of global technology, politics, economics and more.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Lawyer Alex Spiro discusses how he navigates the high-stakes world of litigation on behalf of famous clients like Elon Musk, Jay-Z, Megan Thee Stallion and Alec Baldwin.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang explores Stargate, a $500 billion AI project; she interviews OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and Softbank CEO Masayoshi Son about their vision for the initiative.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang goes inside Stargate, an historic $500 billion bet on the future of AI; she speaks with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and Softbank CEO Masayoshi Son about their hopes for the project.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang speaks with Microsoft titans Bill Gates, Steve Ballmer and Satya Nadella about the company's journey from scrappy startup to global powerhouse.

programme.desc: Emily Chang speaks with Microsoft titans Bill Gates, Steve Ballmer and Satya Nadella about the company's journey from scrappy startup to global powerhouse.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang meets Melinda French Gates in Seattle to discuss how she's navigating her next stage as a philanthropist and investor.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang meets NBA player and Thirty Ink CEO Stephen Curry to discuss his growing business portfolio, partnership with Under Armour and retail ambitions to rival Nike's Jordan Brand; Chang also takes some swings on the golf course with Curry.
